conclusion: We have two objects, A and B, moving in the same direction along a straight line. Their velocities are plotted against time in the graph.
In a v-t graph, the slope of the curve at any point gives the acceleration of the object at that instant.
Both curves start at the origin and reach a maximum velocity before coming back to zero at time t1. Curve A peaks higher and earlier than curve B.

conclusion: The slope is positive when velocity is increasing and negative when velocity is decreasing.

conclusion: For both objects, acceleration is positive when velocity is increasing and negative when velocity is decreasing.
